classFeatures.name: Spellcasting
entries: An event in your past has left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with arcane magic. This font of magic, unlike that of a Sorcerer, originates from the soul. It fuels your spells and augments soul with additional power.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the soulborne spell list. You learn an additional soulborne cantrip of your choice at 4th level and another at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Soulborne table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these soulborne spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell burning hands} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell burning hands} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level spells of your choice from the soulborne spell list.

You learn an additional soulborne spell of your choice at each level except 12th, 14th, 16th, 17th, 18th, and 20th. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the soulborne spells you know and replace it with another spell from the soulborne spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your soulborne spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a soulborne spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You have a trinket that is infused with a portion of your soul, which can be used as an Arcane Focus for your spell casting. It should be visible at all times.

classFeatures.name: Anima Economy
entries: With your Arcane prowess growing, your control over your soul grows. While any other person's soul is a singular entity, the Soulborne's soul has grown beyond this constraint. Instead of a single entity, the Soulborne's soul is supplemented by Anima - additional fragments of souls that orbit the core entity. These Anima become an additional daily resource for the Soulborne.

entries.name: Anima
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your soul's form shifts to being an entity with a force of its own. The core entity of the soulborne's soul develops its own gravitational pull, increasing as you grow in power, that can hold a number of additional soul fragments called Anima.

At 2nd level, your soul has the power to hold four Anima. The maximum amount of Anima available to you increases by two at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 19th level. The table below shows the number of Anima available to you.
Soulborne are able to change the colour of their soul on the magical spectrum, allowing them to tap into spells based on the chosen colour.

Starting at 2nd level, you gain mastery of your soul, allowing you to spend a Bonus Action to switch your soul's colour. Switching colour allows you to cast the corresponding spells at their listed Anima cost instead of a spell slot.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis that alters the evolution of your soul. Your choice grants branching paths at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Soul Scrying
entries: Your affinity with the Arcane nature of your innate Soulborne abilities, and your ability to quickly and effectively manipulate your own soul, has naturally evolved to being able to read the souls of others.

Starting at 6th level, you gain the Soul Scrying feature. When you have completed 8 uninterrupted hours of Soul Scrying, focusing on a single target within 500ft and maintaining concentration on the spell, you come to know the make-up of their soul. You learn the the essence of its being (class,) strength of its Anima (level,) and the purity of the being (alignment.)

classFeatures.name: Soul Shroud
entries: After Soul Scrying has been fully accomplished, you must spend 24 uninterrupted hours wearing the shroud before you can gain the benefits of it. You can store a number of shrouds equal to 2 + your Charisma modifier.
The table below shows an example of Shrouds and their possible effects. As a new Shroud is acquired, the GM will decide with you what the benefits of that Shroud is.

Starting at 6th level, you have the ability to shroud your soul and alter its make-up to be a perfect match of one that you have previously stored. Spending 1 hour and 25gp worth of materials, you can change your Soul Shroud. A Shroud, once equipped, is permanent until you spend an action to wilfully remove or replace it with another. The Shroud you wear persists through unconsciousness and all other effects, but may be dispelled with a high-level Dispel Magic or similar.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Infuse Anima
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher you can infuse your spells with the power of your soul. Take a single damage die of the spell being cast, and for each point of Anima used roll an additional die equal to half of the single damage die.
Example, {@spell Guiding Bolt} cast at 2nd level causing {@dice 5d6} damage would gain an additional {@dice 1d3} damage per point of Anima infused.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Soul Crush
entries: Starting at 17th level, you become a master at reading the souls of your foes in an instant, knowing exactly how to inflict damage to their essence. Target a creature within 60ft and crush their very essence into dust. At the cost of 6 Anima, the targeted creature must make a Constitution check against your Spell Save DC. The creature takes {@dice 7d8 + 24} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. You may only use this ability once per encounter. You cannot empower this ability with additional Anima. This ability does not affect creatures without a living soul, such as Constructs.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Master Manipulator
entries: At 20th level, you become a force to be reckoned with and a master of manipulating souls. Soul Scrying now takes 1 minute to complete, and Soul Shroud takes 1 hour.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

subclassFeatures.name: Adaptive Soul
entries: Through external strife and conflict, the Adaptive soulborne has spent their entire life thus far willing themselves to be someone else in an attempt to fit in with their surroundings. A survival trait that, in anyone else, would be simply a useful tool, has taken hold within the Soulborne's very core and changed how their abilities evolve and manifest. This type of soulborne does not have complete, willful control over their abilities and are instead ruled by emotion.
You also gain the Feature: Adaptive Paths, which adds to your Reactive Soul feature at each level where you gain an Adaptive Soul feature

entries.name: Soul Link
entries: Starting at 3rd level, after spending 10 minutes of casting you link souls with another willing creature. This enables the reactionary feature: Reactive Soul.

entries.name: Reactive Soul
entries: A side effect of the Adaptive Soul is the sway of emotions that dictate their very being. Their abilities come from emotional stimuli more often than their willful intent. The Paths the soulborne takes determine the powers granted.

Starting at 3rd level, when the creature with which you share the Soul Link is attacked and before the GM declares the results of the attack roll, your emotional response manifests into two missiles of Arcane energy.
This feature may only happen if you have not already used a Reaction this round, and can only occur once per round when the first attack roll is made.

subclassFeatures.name: Adaptive Paths
entries: The nature of the Adaptive Soul is the influence that external factors play on their emotions, and their emotional state dictating the evolution of their Soulborne Metamorphosis.

At 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level, you gain the Threshold, Temptation, Transformation, and Atonement Paths respectively. The Adaptive soulborne's path is determined by the emotional stimuli that have affected them most profoundly throughout their life.

entries.name: Ruling Emotions
entries: The Ruling Emotion should be based on the character's roleplay and the most impactful, prominent, or present emotional state of the Adaptive soulborne's current milestone.

Example: at 3rd level, when the Paths first emerge, the backstory of the character and all the events in the first three levels of the Adaptive soulborne's journey thus far will inform the decision. Between 3rd level and 6th level, only the events of the campaign between those milestones should be taken into account unless the GM and player agree otherwise.
This decision should always be made between the Soulborne player and the GM with agreements on both sides.

entries.name: Adaptive Path: Threshold Paths
entries: Starting their journeys, the soulborne will cross the threshold between their past life and their new life of adventuring. Thus the Threshold path sets them on their forward trajectory in life.
Your Reactive Soul ability now acts according to the table below.

entries.name: Adaptive Path: Temptation Paths
entries: As power grows, so does the temptation to abuse that power.
Your Reactive Soul ability now acts according to the table below.

entries.name: Adaptive Path: Transformation Paths
entries: For better or worse, the soulborne's power is manifesting into its own. With the ability to Infuse Anima comes the ability to transform their power. The Transformation step is one that will define them.
Your Reactive Soul ability now acts according to the table below.

entries.name: Adaptive Path: Atonement Paths
entries: For the good you may have done, there will be regrets and sins to attone for. The final stage of the soulborne's journey is one of righting wrongs- no matter how small they may seem.
Your Reactive Soul ability now acts according to the table below.

entries.name: Final Confluence
entries: At 20th level, when Reactive Soul is triggered, all four of the effects from each path that has been taken occur simultaneously.

spell.name: Rejuvenate
entries: You sacrifice Anima to restore a creature you touch. They regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting modifier. This spell has no effect on undead, constructs, or any other creature devoid of a soul.

spell.name: Soothing Spirit
entries: You sacrifice Anima to restore a creature within range. They regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier. This spell has no effect on undead, constructs, or any other creature devoid of a soul.

spell.name: Stable Link
entries: Through your Soul Link, you are able to maintain a stable connection. When your Soul Link partner is taken below 0 hit points, you instantly stabilize them.

spell.name: Discerning Eye
entries: As you watch and react to the attack through the Soul Link, you are able to discern the weaknesses in the attacker's defenses. Instantly through your link, the information is conveyed to you.
On your Soul Link partner's next turn, they gain advantage on their first attack roll against the attacker.

spell.name: Baleful Word
entries: Through the Soul Link, you unleash a single threatening word at the attacker- laced with subtle enchantments that only the target can hear. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 1d4} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Hell's Bells
entries: Bells toll for the victim, signalling their death. Only the target hears the sound. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes {@dice 1d12} necrotic damage.

spell.name: Protector
entries: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects your Soul Link partner. Until the start of their next turn, they have +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and they take no damage from magic missile.

spell.name: Hallowed Link
entries: Your Soul Link partner gets a desperate surge of defensive strength via your link. They can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to either a saving throw (for a saving throw on the incoming attack), or on their first attack roll on their next turn.

spell.name: Fight or Flight
entries: Like the wind, your Soul Link partner cannot be captured. Until the end of your partner's next turn, their movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

On your partner's next turn, their first weapon attack roll against the creature that hit them has advantage. It deals an extra {@dice 1d8} force damage on a hit. Regardless of whether the attack hits or misses, your partner's walking speed is increased by 30 feet until the end of that turn.

spell.name: Soul Sacrifice
entries: If your partner takes damage as part of the attack that has taken place, you may choose to spend 1 Anima to draw that damage through your Soul Link to yourself. In doing so, your partner takes no damage from the attack and you take only half.

spell.name: Eye for an Eye
entries: When your Soul Link partner takes damage, the remorseful emotion bleeds uncontrollably through the bond and arcane force strikes back at the attacker. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@dice 2d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Link of Alacrity
entries: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

spell.name: Chains of Guilt
entries: When your missiles hit the target, a writhing mass of thorny vines appears at the points of impact, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the magical tendrils of arcane energy until the spell ends. A Large or larger creature has advantage on this saving throw. If the target succeeds on the save, the tendrils dissipate into smoke.

While {@condition restrained} by this spell, the target takes {@dice 2d6} piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature {@condition restrained} by the tendrils or one that can touch the creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the target is freed.

spell.name: Tenebrae
entries: You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened} (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Bound by Grief
entries: When your Soul Link partner is attacked, their attack is overcome with grief pouring from you through the link. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed}, ending its current turn and until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Twin Souls
entries: An illusory duplicate of your Soul Link partner appears in their space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with your partner and mimics their actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. Your partner can use their action to dismiss the illusory duplicate.
Each time a creature targets your partner with an attack during the spell's duration, the duplicate is automatically the first to be targeted.

The duplicate's AC equals 10 + your partner's Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits the duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. The duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when the duplicate is destroyed.
A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

spell.name: Blade Ward
entries: You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air. Until the end of your next turn, you have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks.

spell.name: Dancing Lights

components.m: a bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

entries: You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

spell.name: Message

components.m: a short piece of copper wire

entries: You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight line and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

spell.name: Ray of Frost
entries: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes {@dice 1d8} cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Sword Burst
entries: You create a momentary circle of spectral blades that sweep around you. Each creature within range, other than you, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} force damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: True Strike
entries: You extend your hand and point a finger at a target in range. Your magic grants you a brief insight into the target's defenses. On your next turn, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against the target, provided that this spell hasn't ended.
